channel.title: Elasticsearch Initialization on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Initialize Elasticsearch from Snapshot
item.description: This doc has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. We recommend using Stash to backup & restore Elasticsearch database. Don’t know how backup works? Check tutorial on Instant Backup. Initialize Elasticsearch with Snapshot KubeDB supports Elasticsearch database initialization. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.
